# TESS Program G06168

Title: Enabling The First TESS-Gaia Spectro-Temporal Variable Stars Studies

PI: Tzanidakis, Anastasios - University Of Washington

Type: SMALL

Summary: The high cadence, high precision light curves from TESS, combined with long-term epochal spectra from Gaia, will enable a new revolution in variability studies for millions of bright stars. We propose the first case study to utilize this unique joint dataset, by gathering TESS light curves for 1,100 stars identified in the Gaia Photometric Science Alerts that are observable within TESS Cycle 6. These Alerts provide a nearly 10-year baseline with epochal BP/RP spectroscopy for which we have developed an independent calibration. Our pilot study will place the BP/RP epochal spectra onto the TESS system and jointly characterize the variability of stars from minutes to years. Our analysis tools will be made available to the community to enable a wealth of variability studies with TESS and Gaia.


# Sector 070 targets observed (2 min: 73, 20 s: 73)
